title: Helping computer vision and language models understand what they see
summary: Researchers from MIT and the MIT-IBM Watson AI Lab have developed a technique that uses computer-generated data to improve the understanding of vision and language models. By creating a synthetic dataset of images with detailed text descriptions, the researchers were able to train the models to better understand concepts such as object attributes and the arrangement of items in a scene. The technique improved the accuracy of the models by up to 10 percent and could have applications in fields like e-commerce and healthcare. The researchers plan to further improve the visual quality and diversity of the synthetic data and investigate scalability.
